features.name: Continuous Feature
features.description: A continuous feature can represent any decimal number. NaNs can also be included and will be shown on the UI as an outlier (grey by default).

features.name: Discrete Feature
features.description: A discrete feature represents an integer value.

features.name: Categorical Feature (5)
features.description: Categorical features have a predefined set of categories (up to 12 max), and are shown in the order they are defined in the manifest.

features.name: Categorical Feature (9)
features.description: Categorical features have a predefined set of categories (up to 12 max), and are shown in the order they are defined in the manifest.

features.name: Categorical Feature (12)
features.description: Categorical features have a predefined set of categories (up to 12 max), and are shown in the order they are defined in the manifest.
